channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: The McKinney Student Writing Contest Is Now Open!
item.description: The 2025 McKinney Writing Contest is open, and both undergraduate and graduate students are invited to submit entries in a wide range of categories to win cash prizes! Entries are due by midnight on March 11, 2025. Please see the McKinney Writing Contest page for more information, or email the contest committee if you have questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: “Working in the U.S.: CPT & Internships” Workshop to be Held for Graduate Students
item.description: Date: Thursday, January 30, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Be sure to register to join the Center for Career and Professional Development (CCPD) and International Services for Students and Scholars (ISSS) for this in-person workshop to learn about the internship search and the ways to get Curricular Practical Training (CPT) to work in the U.S. before graduation! This session has information specific to graduate students, and space is limited….
item.author: Students

item.title: Career Fair Prep with CCPD Peer Career Advisors to be Held February 4
item.description: Don’t miss this opportunity from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM on Tuesday, February 4 to get insider advice from students who’ve been in your shoes and are now working at the CCPD to help you succeed. Register on Handshake and then bring your questions and get ready to walk into the career fair with confidence!
item.author: Students

item.title: RPI Spirit Day is January 31!
item.description: Date: Friday, January 31, 2025 (all day) - Grab your favorite RPI spirit gear and get ready for this year’s Spirit Day! Just snap a photo in your best red on your preferred social media with #RPISpiritDay2025, or submit your photo via bit.ly, then plan to join us at the Union Horseshoe at 11:30 a.m. on Spirit Day with your spirit gear for a group photo, and to enjoy giveaways and free snacks!
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Schedules February 7 Info Session
item.description: Date: Friday, February 7, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate degrees and certificates. Attendees will also hear details about how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment.

item.title: 2024 Form W-2 Now Available on Employee Self-Service System
item.description: Rensselaer’s Payroll Office is pleased to announce to all members of the campus community that the 2024 W-2 information is now available via the Rensselaer Self-Service Information System. Paper forms will be mailed to by January 31, 2025.
item.author: Community

item.title: Computer Science Colloquia, “Debugging Programs for School, Fun, and Profit,” Scheduled for January 31
item.description: Date: Friday, January 31, 2025 4:30 PM - 6:00 PM - In this seminar, RPI’s current Hacker-in-Residence Jeremy Blackthorne will show better ways to debug that you need to know using ChatGPT, as well as cover free tools for debugging, tracing, and profiling like VS Code, Ghidra, IDA Free, and various other command line utilities like ltrace, strace, latrace, gprof, and more!

item.title: Be a Part of the Spirit Day Photo on January 31!
item.description: Date: Friday, January 31, 2025 11:15 AM - 11:30 AM - Don’t forget to wear your best RPI gear and meet at the Union Horseshoe this Friday for the Annual Spirit Day photo!

item.title: Lean Green Belt Certification Scheduled for February 21 - 23
item.description: The Industrial & Systems Eng. Dept. and IISE student chapter, along with Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers (IISE) Headquarters, will present a short course on Lean Green Belt Certification from February 22-23 on the Rensselaer campus, taught by Dr. Asian Ghosh. Register by February 7 to receive a discounted rate; the last day to register for the course is February 17.

item.title: HR to Hold Professional Development Workshop, “Leading from Anywhere”
item.description:
Description: At Rensselaer, we maintain that “leadership” involves a learnable set of actions and behaviors that is available to everyone. In this workshop, scheduled to be held from 9am to 11am on February 20, participants will explore the tenants that comprise everyday leadership and discuss the behaviors that define leadership not as positional or based on title, but rather on values and actions.
